com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue

Interface YFSValidateInvokedCollectionUE


  • public interface YFSValidateInvokedCollectionUE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct validateInvokedCollection(YFSEnvironment env, YFSExtnPaymentCollectionInputStruct inStruct)
      The YFSValidateInvokedCollectionUE user exit helps in processing charge transaction records.

    • Method Detail

      • validateInvokedCollection

        YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct validateInvokedCollection(YFSEnvironment env,
                                                               YFSExtnPaymentCollectionInputStruct inStruct)
                                                        throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException

        The YFSValidateInvokedCollectionUE user exit helps in processing charge transaction records. In certain scenarios while calling collection user exits for the purpose of authorizing and charging through payment collection agent, it may result in an error condition while making a connection with an external system (bank,paypal,other payment systems). This results in charge transaction record in a limbo status.

        The charge transaction record is marked with user exit status as INVOKED. Now there could have been two possiblities. The authorization or charging acutally went through, but the system never got that information back or the authorization or charging didn't actually go through. This user exit helps in processing such charge transaction records. Every collection record with USER_EXIT_STATUS in invoked status will be passed to this user exit by either the executeCollection API or the payment execution agent.

        If this user exit is not implemented the charge transaction record will remain in INVOKED status and will not be picked up by the payment execution agent or executeCollection API. If this user exit is implemented then the following is expected from this user exit:

        • With the chargeTransactionKey in the input, contact the external payment system to find out if a transaction exists with this particular chargeTransactionKey. The assumption here is that external payment systems are also recording the chargeTransactionKey (system identifier) along with every transaction.
        • If the transaction exists with this particular chargeTransactionKey then get all the relevant authorization or charging data and return that information in the output struct. Ensure that you have set the bPreviousInvocationSuccessful field in the output struct to true.
        • If the transaction does not exist in the external payment system with this particular chargeTransactionKey then just return the output struct with the bPreviousInvocationSuccessful field set to false. The Sterling system will assume that previous invocation was not successful and automatically clear off the INVOKED status so that this charge transaction record can be processed again.

        To code custom user exits, implement the method in this interface. The system calls the method in your class. If this method gives any exception, the current transaction is rolled back.


        Pre-conditions: This user exit is called only if the user exit status of the charge transaction record is INVOKED.

        Post-conditions: Payment collection receives a confirmation about the way in which the payment collection has happened or the fact that the previous invocation was not successful.


        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inStruct - Required. For details on the input, see YFSExtnPaymentCollectionInputStruct.


        Returns:
        outStruct For details on the output, see YFSExtnPaymentCollectionOutputStruct.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSUserExitException - This exception is thrown whenever system errors that the application cannot handle are encountered. The transaction is aborted and changes are rolled back.
